intro: Odontarrhena elatior, commonly known as the tall toothed grass, is a perennial herb native to southern Africa. It belongs to the grass family Poaceae and is characterized by its tall, slender stems and narrow, blade-like leaves. The plant typically grows in open grasslands and is adapted to dry and semi-arid conditions. It produces small, inconspicuous flowers arranged in spikelets, which are typical of the grass family. Odontarrhena elatior is often used in traditional medicine and is also valued for its ornamental appeal in landscaping.
